title: I Kant believe this logo
content:
This is a very nice logo type (in my humble opinion) designed by the people at Underware.

I was wondering if anyone could point me to typefaces that might have influenced this design or share a similar feel?

Thanks,

Dom

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [kant-00-first.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821131725/http:/typophile.com/files/kant-00-first.jpg) | 16.72 KB |

 [‹ (x) Visa corporate sans - Whitney {Florian}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821131725/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41576 "Go to previous forum topic") [Some fonts… ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821131725/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45234 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Dominic Forde

comments.content: It’s really lovely indeed! [Coptek](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821131725/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/stewf/376692638/) is the first typeface that comes to mind, though it’s really more like Underware’s Masterfile logo.

Thanks Stephen.

I like it’s Eddie Van Halen swagger.

Its a great piece of type...  
Especially when its made up of nothing more than 13 straight lines.
London 2012 font also has a similar feeling.
I love it too. “13 straight lines”...
